    import Francy from 'francy-js/src/francy.js'
    public class | version 0.2.0 | source

    Francy

    Francy is the main entry point for the whole framework. By passing an input string/object to the {Francy.handle} function, Francy will handle the creation of that json as long it is a valid and understandable json object to Francy.

    Example:

    let francy = new Francy({verbose: true, appendTo: '#div-id', callbackHandler: console.log});
francy.render(json);

    Method Summary

    Public Methods
    public

    render(input: String): Object

    Main entry point.

    Public Methods

    public render(input: String): Object source

    Main entry point. Calling handle passing a json representation string will trigger the drawing of a json object.

    Params:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    input String

    a json string/object render

    Return:

    Object

    the element created
